reporting-org.narrative: Norad - Norwegian Agency for Development Cooperation

title.narrative: Improved Access to Health-Related Products for Covid-19 and Pandemic Preparedness in Ethiopia

description.narrative: The Government of Norway to support the Government of Ethiopia's national Covid-19 strategy. The project aims to support the implementation of the Extended ComBAT campaign in order to avoid an additional burden of preventable morbidity and mortality. The outcome is to strengthen the capacity of laboratories and intensive care units in four high-need regions in Ethiopia to deliver essential services. The Project aims to provide services to beneficiaries with a gender equality approach, reaching women and men equally and to report on achievement based on gender disaggregated data. 1.1: At least 4 laboratories receive essential equipment (PCR machine, biosafety hoods, freezers) 1.2: Each laboratory receives at least two training/supervision visits from WHO staff to ensure proper use of equipment 2.1 : At least 6 COVID-19 treatment centers receive essential equipment (oxygen concentrators, pulse oximeters, oxygen cylinders, flowmeters, regulators, oxygen delivery sets) 2.2: Each treatment center receives at least two training/supervision visits from WHO staff to ensure proper use of equipment 3.1 The progress/final report to for this project includes reporting on the risks outlined in the risk assessment framework

participating-org.narrative: Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs - Embassies
